full_text: SIZE 1 (2) 3 (4) 5 (6) 7 (8) MEASUREMENTS Chest circumference: 91 (103) 114 (126) 137 (149) 160 (171) cm / 35.75 (40.5) 45 (49.5) 54 (58.75) 63 (67.25) inches Length, center back: 58 (60) 61 (62) 64 (65) 67 (69) cm / 22.75 (23.5) 24 (24.5) 25.25 (25.5) 26.5 (27.25) inches Sleeve length: 46 (44) 42 (40) 38 (36) 34 (32) cm / 18.1 (17.3) 16.5 (15.7) 15.0 (14.2) 13.4 (12.6) in Designed with 20-40 cm / 8-16 inches of positive ease. The model in the picture has a chest circumference of 105.5 cm / 41.5 inches and is wearing a size 6. MATERIALS Version 1: Merino, COPENHAGEN Fibers: Color A: 5 (5) 6 (6) 7 (8) 8 (9) skeins, color 2 Color B: 5 (5) 6 (6) 7 (8) 8 (9) skeins, color 7 Version 2: Merino, COPENHAGEN Fibers: Color A: 5 (5) 6 (6) 7 (8) 8 (9) skeins, color 15 Color B: 5 (5) 6 (6) 7 (8) 8 (9) skeins, color 13 Circular needles 4 mm, 40, 60 and 80 cm Circular needles 3.5 mm 40 and 80 cm Double pointed needles 3.5 and 4 mm if using the magic loop method, double pointed needles can be omitted. 4 stitch markers YARN QUALITY Merino, COPENHAGEN Fibers 100% Wool 50 g = 108 m GAUGE 21 sts x 31 r = 10 x 10 cm / 4 x 4 inches in 6x6 rib stitch pattern (k6, p6) using needles 4 mm Always use the needle size that gives you the correct gauge in both height and width, measured after washing and blocking. PATTERN INFORMATION The Thekla Sweater is knitted from the top-down in 6x6 rib with narrow stripes in two colors. The shoulders are shaped with increases on both the front and back. The shoulder stitches are placed on hold. The front and back pieces are worked back and forth before being joined under the armhole to form the body. The sleeves are worked in the round across the resting shoulder stitches together with stitches picked up along the armhole.
